result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek S. Nehls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions for Counts 1, 2 and 3: Attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment or educational programs ordered by the agent. Obey rules/regulations of probation. Submit to AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations. For the first two years of probation, attend weekly alcohol support group once per week. Court costs have been waived by the Court for all three of these counts though restitution has been ordered for Count 3. Additionally, Count 4 is a non-probation count and the Defendant has been ordered to pay a fine/costs for that count with those to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Conditions specific to Count 2: 6 months conditional jail time. Costs have been waived by the Court for this count.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Additional conditions for Count 3: 120 days conditional jail time, consecutive to the conditional time in Count 2. Restitution has tentatively been set at $20,550 though the Court is allowing the Victim/Witness Coordinator 30 days to provide documentation to the Defense/Atty. Gleason; if Atty. Gleason objects to the details of the amount requested and tentatively ordered, a restitution hearing will be set.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
With work release, consecutive to Count 2.
Consecutive to: Count 2

supervisions.notes: This is a non-probation count. The fine and costs associated with this charge are to be paid by the Defendant directly to the Clerk of Court. If the Defendant is unable to pay in full within 60 days of disposition, he may seek a payment plan with the Clerk of Court for monthly installment payments.
Pay directly to the Clerk of Court.

With huber and consecutive to the time set out as conditional time for Counts 2 and 3.
Consecutive to: Counts 2 and 3
Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed.

3 cases together for sentence: 14CM174/battery, 15CF76, fleeing, burglary, operate w/o owner's consent, and OWI 2nd, and 17CF11/substantial battery. Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court, in custody, with attorney Brian Walter Gleason. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Gleason calls witnesses on behalf of the Defendant. Counsel argue their positions on sentence. Def addresses the Court.

Sentence:

14CM174 - Count 1/battery: 2 years probation with same conditions as in 15CF76.
Credit in the event of revocation: 0 days


15CF76

Count 1/fleeing or eluding: 3 years probation with same conditions as Counts 2 and 3

Count 2/burglary: 3 years probation with conditions of 6 mo conditional jail; attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment or educational programs ordered by agent; obey rules/regs; aoda/follow through with treatment recommendations; for first 2 years of probation, attend weekly alcohol support group once per week.

Count 3/drive or operate mv w/o owner's consent: 3 years probation with same conditions as Count 2 with additional 120 days consecutive county jail. Restitution: $20,550 requested but no formal order yet made at this time. Credit: CC. Court orders documentation provided by VWC Fields to Atty. G within 30 days; if Atty. G objects, restitution hearing to be set. 

Count 4/OWI 2nd: $350 base fine plus costs for $1379 total; $77 blood draw reimbursement to RCSD; 10 days jail consecutive to time set out in other counts; 14 mo revocation; 14 mo IID; aoda/driver safety plan to be relicensed. 60 days to pay. This fine and costs to be collected by Clerk of Court.

Credit in the event of revocation: 0 days.


17CF11 - Count 1/substantial battery:  5 1/2 months jail with credit for 166 days - time served sentence. Costs waived.
AMENDED to include 14CT42 as one of the read-in cases.
Sentencing hearing on July 11, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
AMENDED with numbers of DRI cases
Sentencing hearing on July 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Walter Gleason in court for Defendant Derek S. Nehls. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek S. Nehls in court in custody. Several cases called together this date for plea hearing or status:

17CF14, 17CF11, 16CF60, 16CF56, 15CF76, 15CM75, 14CM174, and 14CT42.

DA recites parties agreements for the 8 cases, as follows:

17CF11 - def to plead to Count 1/substantial battery; remaining counts to be DRI; counsel to request PSI and free to argue on sentence.

15CF76 - Def pleading to Counts 1/fleeing, 2/PTAC burglary, 3/OMV WOC; counsel to request PSI and free to argue. Def to plead to Count 4/OWI 2nd w/intoxication due to meth; requesting minimum guidelines dispo. Remaining counts to be DRI.

14CM174 - Def pleading to Count 1/battery; remaining counts to be DRI.

14CT42 - DRI
15CM75 - DRI
16CF56 - DRI
16CF60 - DRI
17CF14 - DRI

Def pleads guilty to the counts indicated by counsel as part of the agreement. Court's colloquy on plea. Finding of guilty. Counts indicated as subject to DRI ordered dismissed and read-in. PSI ordered; due 7/7/17 with author to attend sentencing in person or by phone. Sentencing set for 7/13 at 1:30.

Def is on bond. Atty. Gleason asks for def's release on electronic monitoring until the date/time of sentencing. Court denies the request. Bond remains as previously set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
